slide_title_6: 6. Safety tips when choosing your TV app on mobile
slide_content_6:
The internet is a wonderful inexhaustible source of content, of the most varied, which even allows you to watch television from other devices. This is a comfort and an economy in many ways. However, there are a few things you should know before making your choice.

If you do a quick search on any Internet search engine in order to find a way to watch TV online, you will find several options. However, as with other things on the internet, there are dangers. Unfortunately, most of these options, both websites and software , are loaded with malware .

Basically, they force you to download content you don't want, often without even knowing you're downloading it. The result of this can be very different, depending on the case, but it ranges from overloading your device's memory to, in extreme cases, stealing precious information that you store on your cell phone or tablet .

Since there is a great demand for TV channels on the internet, this is a niche that is heavily exploited by scammers. Thus, we always recommend that your choice is based on reliable content, such as the ones we provide daily here.

Therefore, whenever you have any doubts about which application to download for the most varied purposes, we invite you to browse our website and see the best recommendations for you not only to have the best in hand, but also to have the safest.

Made a beautiful drawing you’re really proud of? Now you need to export it as an image file. Open the Actions menu and click “Share”.

Here you can export your image in a number of different settings, but the most commonly used image settings are JPEG and PNG. You could also export as a PSD file if you wanted to import your image into Photoshop.

To export a time-lapse process video of your drawing, click “Video”. You can press “Time-lapse replay” to watch the whole replay of the making of your drawing, and press “Export time-lapse video” to export the video as a full length or 30-second video. This is also where you can turn the time-lapse recording off if you’re not a fan of this setting.
slide_content_11: Procreate recently added animation tools to the app, revealing a whole new world of creative options. Although it is not a fully professional tool for animation, you can create some really polished and beautiful work, and definitely learn some animation basics like ball bounces and walk cycles.
slide_content_12:
Under “Actions”, under “Preferences” and in “Gesture controls”, you can add a gesture to activate QuickMenu.

This menu can be activated on your canvas while you’re drawing to quickly access some common settings, which will help you speed up the process of drawing and using Procreate. You can personalize your QuickMenu with settings you use most often.
slide_content_13:
You won’t learn how to use Procreate overnight, especially if you’ve never used a digital drawing program before. But as you spend more time experimenting and using the app, you’ll find you become more comfortable with the menus and options, and can confidently navigate the space and make beautiful drawings.

When it comes to drawing in general, continuing to practice and draw from life will always improve your skills. Don’t put too much pressure on yourself to be perfect straight away, but stay confident that you’ll get to the point where you can make artwork that you’re really proud of using just your iPad, Pencil and Procreate.

Procreate has helped to make digital art more affordable and accessible for everyone, though it can take some time to learn about the numerous menus and settings available within the app.

There is so much you can do in Procreate, so this article really just skims the surface of what’s on offer. But I hope it has given you the introduction you need to feel confident using Procreate to create beautiful digital drawings.
